boardgame.name: Western Legends: Wooden Stores Larger Than Sleeves Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description:
This pack includes the Trader Cart from the Blood Money expansion and extensions for the Wooden General Store and Trading for enlarging your original wooden Trading Post and General Store in order to make them compatible with sleeved cards.

Please note that you will need to remove the original insert from the base game box to fit these new stores.

Includes:
- Wooden Trader Cart (LTS edition)
- Wooden General Store extension pieces
- Wooden Trading Post extension pieces

boardgame.name: DORF
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A 0-HD adventure that was built for the DURF Jam 2021.

boardgame.name: District 9: The Boardgame – Faction Expansion
boardgame.description:
The 5&6 player faction expansion for District 9: The Boardgame requires the core game in order to be used. These factions may be used in tow different ways.

ALTERNATE FACTION: In a 2-4 player game, the Prawn Engineer or MNU Science Division may be selected by a player and set up as normal as defined by the setup section of the core rulebook.

ADDITIONAL PLAYERS: If desired, the new factions allow for 5 & 6 player games of the District 9 boardgame. To use the expansions in this manner, simply follow the setup section of the core rulebook, and add steps for the 5th and/or 6th player.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Trajno
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

In a world where the old order is collapsing, unguarded treasure can be a powerful motivator. Grab some buddies and get some loot and you can figure out the rest later.

boardgame.name: 5-Kampf
boardgame.description:
The game consists of 5 exercises where players can score points. Whoever has collected the most points after the 5 exercises wins the game.
Exercise 1: Reaction test
Exercise 2: Memory test
Exercise 3: Skill test
Exercise 4: Combination test
Exercise 5: Faultfinding test

—user summary

boardgame.name: Glory: A Game of Knights – Metal Coins
boardgame.description:
A set of 24 metal coins resembling Prague pennies and florins.

Metal coins:
-16 pcs with a diameter of 28mm (silver)
-8 pcs with a diameter of 21mm (gold)

boardgame.name: Pierwszy Obywatel
The Spin Doctors
boardgame.description:
The Spin Doctors is a game in which the players take on the role of the chief of staff and help their candidates in entering upon the highest office in the country.

The player, having a predetermined budget at their disposal, chooses appropriate campaign workers and uses their cards in each round to send them to different regions of the country with different tasks. Those could be an election rally, fundraising or an election trail. But they could also be a little less friendly forms of rivalry like incitement against political opponents, manipulation or propaganda. The player has to remember however, to plan these actions out carefully because all the campaign workers have their own distinct abilities, useful in specific situations, and only a limited number of them can carry out their tasks in each round. Moreover, the players have to predict the moves and the plans of their opponents, as the cards are placed on the board face down. They know where their opponents are sending their people, but they do not know which ones and with what tasks. They can also use their campaign workers to cooperate with the media, which can influence the turnout in several regions of the country as well as the topics important for the local communities.
Additionally, the players must prepare an election program for their candidates and make sure that they fulfil as many promises as possible. Each mistake means a loss of votes and the risk of defeat.

Campaign workers’ actions influence the endorsement in each region and allow the candidates to earn endorsement points there. The one with the most endorsement points becomes the winner in the given region and gains votes from the local electorate which can represent one of 4 social groups.

The player with the most votes in all social groups at the end of the game wins the elections and becomes president.
But remember that politics is often a brutal fight which doesn’t always encourage fair play, and media manipulation, provocation or leakage of compromising material are only a few of the challenges you will have to face. Everybody wants to win, and they will do anything to reach their goal.

Do you have the guts to grab for power?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Da lacht das Sparschwein
boardgame.description:
The players move their game pieces over a circuit by rolling the dice and can win money from the bank on the individual fields, lose money to the piggy bank or receive the collected contents of the piggy bank. The first player to collect 10 marks wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: M.E.R.C. (M&M3E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever wondered where your favorite villain hires his gun-toting thugs? The answer is M.E.R.C., a “company” that recruits, trains, equips, and supplies mercenaries and super powered muscle to the world's tyrants, dictators, and supervillains.

boardgame.name: The Watchers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masters of the Six Elements

These adventurers have shown skill with sword, mastery of magic, and above all, rare qualities of character. They’ve been chosen to join the ancient order of Watchers, but first they must pass a test of cleverness and mettle. The challenge: recover six crystal shards from six magically protected chambers, wield the six weapons of elemental power on the field of battle, and shape your destiny.

The Watchers is an old-school dungeon crawl that uses new-school technology to create an immersive experience for the players: Throughout the text are links to YouTube videos depicting various dungeon environments in stunning detail, created using advanced video game technology. The adventure also includes six pre-generated characters.

boardgame.name: LFG Class Pack: Gaslight Characters, Volume II
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Five more Victorian-themed character classes compatible with the Low Fantasy Gaming system ready for your gaslight setting. Easily convertible to 5th Edition D&D as well. Volume II includes:


The Mesmerist: a hypnotist who manipulates minds, implanting suggestions in others and convincing them to do what the mesmerist wills.
The Metamorph: a changer of physical from, presenting as either the classic Jekyll and Hyde scientist-turned-monster, or as an avenging avatar of Ba'al, Lord of Crows.
The Occultist: a person sensitive to spirits and the supernatural, who not only is aware of otherworldly beings but can conduct rituals to contact them and use some of their power;
The Septon: a priest of the Seven Ancients whose virtues and holy rites fight back against the powers of darkness;
The Sin-Eater: a rare but necessary individual who literally consumes evil to redeem others from eternal damnation, purging afflicted souls of their unforgiven evil deeds, one bite at a time.


These characters are setting-agnostic and can fit into any campaign world with Gothic themes, Steampunk trappings, or 19th century urban vibes.

boardgame.name: Heroic Armory: Supply Drop VII
Heroic Armory: Supply Drop Vol. VII
Ice Hunter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Aedrenar! A New Post-Apocalyptic Fantasy World full of adventure, designed for masked vigilantes and treasure hunters alike!

Need some new equipment and items for your would-be vigilante? This book introduces a mix of new weapons and equipment useful for any self-respecting crime-fighter or half-decent detective.

Each volume in this new series details a small bit of backstory behind one of Aedrenar's greatest heroes (or villians), and provides some information about some of the gear they carried with them at different times. The best thing, is these heroes have long since had their time (or are prone to lending gear out to fellow heroes), so it can be used in creating your own!

Heroic Armory is a sourcebook for the Aedrenar Campaign Setting, which details new rules for outfitting powerful heroes. It includes a new 'Iconic Artifact' system, as well as numerous new magical devices that are useful to any character!

boardgame.name: The Slave Mines of Vindicus the Terrible
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Inspired by Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom and the exciting action of Saturday morning cartoons, Slaves Mines of Vindicus the Terrible is a level 0 (or origin story) for your group's adventures in Barbarians of the Ruined Earth! Each player controls four children characters escaping the dangerous slave mines of the vile Sorcerer.

To gain their freedom, the characters must pit their cunning, whatever equipment they can find, and their talents against waves of robots, hideous monsters, and a vile Overseer.

This adventure contains 30 full-color illustrations by many of the same awesome artists from the Barbarians of the Ruined Earth rulebook and some new artists as well, 10 new enemies to pit your player's against in future games and rules for Swarm creatures!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Primitives vol 4
boardgame.description: Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume IV samples more of the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the 'Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to ˆ_Ñ??modern standardsˆ? and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Meme vs 100cia: CEO Ludoty promo card
boardgame.description:
A promo Scientist card delivered in the November 2021 Ludoty Box.

Alba (CEO Ludoty)

This is fine: You can't lose if you're waiting for your Ludoty.
Dream Team: Take 1 Troll for each Ludoty you have received.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Primitives vol 3
boardgame.description: Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume 3 samples more of the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the 'Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to ˆ_Ñ??modern standardsˆ? and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 14 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Primitives vol 2
boardgame.description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume 2 samples more of the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the 'Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to ˆ_Ñ??modern standardsˆ? and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Hero Pack 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Icons Assembled!

Ten years ago, Icons line artist Dan Houser released the first of a series of "Hero Packs," character collections inspired and created by the Icons community. Now the first of these has been updated for the Assembled Edition of the game. Hero Pack 1 presents a collection of ninety diverse characters from the history of Icons Superpowered Roleplaying, created and inspired by members of the Icons community and reenvisioned by artist Dan Houser.

• Hero, Villain, or…? Some of the characters from Hero Pack are heroes, others villains, anti-heroes, or even ambiguous figures who might be hero or villain depending on the situation.

• Inspiration! Use the characters from Hero Pack as inspiration and a jumping-off point for creating unique characters in your own Icons games!

• Examples: The characters in Hero Pack offer examples of power configurations, abilities, qualities, possibilities and more you can use for your own games.

• Standees: The digital version includes an 11-page PDF of printable character standees for all of the characters in the book.

Updated with all-new art based on the original Hero Pack release, with game information updated to the Assembled Edition of Icons by designer Steve Kenson. It makes a great companion volume to villain collections like Icons Adversaries or Rogues to supplement your options for allies, adversaries, and oddities for your Icons game!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Primitives vol 1
boardgame.description: Experimental Tech Readout: Primitives, Volume 1 samples the early technology designs that dominated the universe of BattleTech during the pre-Star League Age of War period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the primitive technology level of the first generation of BattleMechs, the last generation of Combat Vehicles (before the 'Mech supplanted them), and the low-tech aerospace units that flew above them. Although many were ultimately upgraded to ˆ_Ñ??modern standardsˆ? and shown in Technical Readout: 3075, the units featured here reflect these designs as they were when first introduced to the universe they fought for. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 Primitive BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Invocación Fronteras: Playmat Oficial Invocador
boardgame.description:
Individual playmat for Invocación Fronteras.

These are personalized playmats measuring 45x30cm, with the design of the board to play Invocación Fronteras.

You have 10 different designs to choose!

They are made of Blackout Canvas, which makes them flexible, waterproof and easy to clean.

They are a perfect companion to set the table and play comfortably.

boardgame.name: Scientist Snatch
boardgame.description:
From introduction:

A Savage Worlds One Sheet for use with Aether Adrift

A scientist researching ancient alien technology is kidnapped from his lab and taken to further the goals of an evil alien empire. Will the Heroes be able to rescue him before they complete their diabolical schemes?

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Republic vol 3
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Republic (Volume 3) samples production and custom machines that have appeared in the BattleTech universe by the early decades of the thirty-second century. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in both Tactical Operations and Interstellar Operations--now employed by the armed forces of the Republic of the Sphere and its contemporaries.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace and battle armor units ready for play in BattleTech games up to the year 3146.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Desmond Faron: Human Frontline Leader
boardgame.description:
From introduction:

Desmond is a Fiercely loyal man with a strict code of honor and a stubborn streak that runs the length of his body. Desmond is good at holding a team together, and can more than hold his own in a fight. He prefers close quarters combat and knows how to put a shield to good use.

boardgame.name: Ebbi Ulwa: Mikwa Nanotechnician
boardgame.description:
From introduction:

Ebbi Ulwa is a talented mechanic with an obsessive interest in Precursor and Human technology that rivals Doctor Alkaev’s own. She is very creative, able to think up mechanical solutions on the spot. She is very cautious, always taking her time until she sees something that catches her eye; An interesting piece of tech will make her rush ahead haphazardly.

boardgame.name: Francine Elliot: Madcap Human Gunslinger
boardgame.description:
From introduction:

Francine Elliot is a thrill seeking adrenaline junkie with a taste for adventure and a love for treasure. Most would call her reckless, but her fiery spirit and never-say-die attitude makes her jump at missions most ‘sensible’ types avoid.

boardgame.name: Geri Griggs: Pacifist Fulgori Rebel Guardian
boardgame.description:
From introduction:

Geri Griggs is a hulking brute of a fulgori with a crooked, malformed face. Despite his frightening appearance, Geri is kind to a fault, refusing to kill, or even seriously injure, even if his life is on the line. He wields a massive shield so that he can protect those he holds dear

boardgame.name: Mikki Pakah: Tribal Mikwa Sharpshooter
boardgame.description:
From introduction:

Mikki Pakah is a Mikwa ranger - an elite woodswoman who knows how to survive and thrive in the wild, and who knows how to put a rifle to good use. She can be awkward and quiet, but she has a heroic spirit that demands she help whenever she sees someone in need.

boardgame.name: Richard: Posh Medical Robot
boardgame.description:
From introduction:

The Designated Infirmary Care unit, or Richard for short, is well programmed for the care of Humans, and recently, Mikwa. He performs admirably at his job, and is quite liked by his patients for his professional demeanor, and his smooth, unambiguously british accent.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Republic vol 2
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Republic II samples production and custom machines that have appeared in the BattleTech universe by the early decades of the thirty-second century. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in Tactical Operations--now employed by the armed forces of the Republic of the Sphere and its contemporaries.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace and battle armor units, ready for play in BattleTech games up to the year 3136.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Mindburners: Into The Void
boardgame.description:
Mindburners: Into the Void is a strategic cyber-occult card drafting and arrangement game for 1-2 players. Loaded up with experimental gear and thrust into the swirling chaos beyond against your will, you must equip and optimize your limited void-tech and outperform your adversary.

In Mindburners: Into the Void, players are disposable test clones owned by Null Corporation, purveyors of the dark waste's finest void-tech. In the company's annual culling rites, a pair of clones are given the opportunity to earn their freedom by testing Null Corporation's most dangerous experimental technology.

Through two alternating rounds of drafting, each player will select their choice of five untested void-tech items, then simultaneously reveal and arrange them in a personal tableau to maximize their score based on position, bonus card scoring abilities, and special triggered abilities.

The player with the most victory points by the end of the scoring phase survives (wins) and is granted their freedom. The other perishes in the cold writhing darkness of the horrific unknown...and is also granted their freedom.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Republic vol 1
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Republic (Volume 1) samples production and custom machines that have appeared in the BattleTech universe by the early decades of the thirty-second century. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the new technologies that debuted in Tactical Operations - now employed by the armed forces of the Republic of the Sphere and its contemporaries.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace and battle armor units, ready for play in BattleTech games up to the year 3120.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Invocación Fronteras: Leyendas del Invocador Solitario – El Gólem Demente
boardgame.description:
Solitaire mode expansion for Invocación Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

Yogzethot (54 - Earth/Fire)
Incubo (26 - Air): A player discard 1 from their hand, you take 2 from the Portal.



To play in this 1-player mode, you only need a Summon deck and at least one board with which to correctly position the cards of the artificial opponent: the Golem.

The objective of the game is to survive until the end of your 6 summons and get more points than the Golem. If the Golem manages to win 4 matches, the player loses the match and is defeated.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Most Wanted
boardgame.description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Most Wanted samples custom machines that have appeared in the BattleTech universe since the days of the Jihad. Each unit featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere in their war against the Word of Blake, as first described in Tactical Operations--deployed now by some of the Inner Sphere's most dangerous criminals.

Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace and battle armor units, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – 3039 and 3050 Cards
boardgame.description: Alpha Strike 3039 and 3050 Cards includes 108 double-sided cards with all the game stats players need to instantly take to the battlefield. The cards reflect the Units listed in Technical Readout: 3039 and Technical Readout: 3050 and include conventional infantry and Clan Elemental battle armor. Quick-start cards allow you to play Alpha Strike right out of the box. Full-color and laminated for dry-erase use, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

boardgame.name: The Legacy Game
boardgame.description:
A mystery box filled with puzzles, evidence, and interviews will be delivered to your door. Each box is a standalone mystery that requires no additional boxes to complete.

Hillview Academy is the most elite private school in Valley Falls. Six of Hillview’s finest receive a mysterious invitation in their locker to participate in something called The Legacy Game. The game will begin promptly at midnight in the local cemetery at the gravesite of Jefferson F. Pritchard, which the letter describes as one of Valley Falls' most infamous citizens. The invitation, sent from someone calling themselves The Headmaster, promises a life-changing reward for the winner. However, no one has ever heard of Jefferson F. Pritchard, and Hillview Academy doesn't have a headmaster. What is The Legacy Game, who is The Headmaster, and what is so special about a dead man that doesn't show up in any of the Valley Falls history books? Play The Legacy Game and find out!

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike – Ad Hoc Unit Cards
boardgame.description: Alpha Strike Ad Hoc Unit Cards includes 90 cards with all the game stats players need to instantly take to the battlefield. Eighty of the cards reflect the Units listed in Alpha Strike, while 10 cards feature notable MechWarrior Units. With these cards, you just need miniatures and you'll be playing BattleTech like never before!

boardgame.name: Yak
boardgame.description:
In Yak, the village elder has given you (and others) the task of constructing a great stone tower to guide the merchants and their yaks in the Himalayas. Each turn, a yak pulls its cart into your village. Will you find stones for your tower, or food for your reserves? Or will you need to visit the market to find what you need?

Over the course of the game, each player builds their own stone tower by acquiring stones from visiting merchants. You start the game with one good of each type (meat, milk, bread) and three cards in hand: build, restock, and market. Three or four carts being pulled by yaks start on the game board, with each player having one cart in front of them and each cart containing three stones and some food. Each cart has a restriction on it, e.g., "no bread" because its yak is gluten intolerant.

On a turn, all players choose a card in hand simultaneously and place it face-down. Starting with whoever holds the baby yak token, players then take their turns in order by revealing their card. If you played:


Build: Spend 1-5 food tokens, placing them in the cart in front of you, to buy 1-3 stones from that cart. You must follow the restriction on that cart. (No meat for the vegetarian yak, please!) If you acquire crystal stones, you must pay one extra food for each such stone. Place the stones in your tower, with all stones after your first needing to touch. Your tower is at most five stones wide.



Restock: Take all the food of one type from the cart in front of you and add it to your reserves up to your limit of eight items of food. Then draw a stone from the quarry bag and place it in the cart. (A cart can hold at most four stones.)



Market: Take two food items of your choice from the market, which starts with two foods of each type and which is refilled only when a cart exceeds its nine-food limit during a build action. Then draw three stones from the bag, place one in a cart of your choice, then return the other two to the bag.


Stones come in eight colors, with eight of each in the bag. Eight crystal stones are also in the bag, along with five fog stones. Whenever fog stones are drawn, all players reverse the direction of all the carts, then the active player sets the fog aside and draws replacement stones, with carts reversing again should fog be drawn anew. Once the right number of non-fog stones have been drawn, place the fog stones on the mountain track. This track will be filled twice during the game, after which only a single fog will remain in the bag.

To end a round, return your chosen card to your hand, move the yak carts one space in the direction they face, then pass the baby yak clockwise. Continue playing rounds until someone completes the fourth level of their tower. Complete that round, play one additional round, then score the towers. A crystal stone can be a color of your choice, but each crystal in your tower must be a different color. You score points (1) for each group of two or more stones (e.g., a group of six is worth 16 points), (2) for the number of groups of at least two or more stones, (3) for individual stones (only 1 point each), (4) for triggering the end of the game, and (5) for having the most remaining food.

For an additional challenge, play Yak with the "master builder" variant. Reveal three of the eight objective cards at the start of play. By having the most non-crystal stones of a color or placing them in certain locations in your tower, you score additional points.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.

Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: I Cavalieri della Tavola Rotonda
boardgame.description:
Fill all the seats on the Round Table. Each turn you can fill one or two (adjacent) seats. The player filling the last seat wins.

The game reimplements Nimclock, a Nim variant.

Published on History Kids, Italian edition, issue #5.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ready Set Bet
boardgame.description:
In Ready Set Bet, you and your friends head to the races for a day of cheering, jeering, and betting on your favorite horses, whose fates hang on every roll of the dice.

Ready Set Bet is played over four rounds. Each round consists of a race followed by bet resolution. During each race, players freely place their bet tokens on the board while the race is going on. After each race, players win or lose money for each of their placed bet tokens, then receive a VIP Club Card to help them win more money in the following races. After four rounds, the player with the most money wins!

—description from the publisher

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: 100% Orange Juice - Syura & Nanako Character Pack
boardgame.description: This Extra Character Pack for 100% Orange Juice adds 2 new playable characters from developer Orange_Juice's games - Nanako and Syura, as well as announcer and character voices for them!

boardgame.name: Aeon's End - Promo Pack 1
boardgame.description: This promo pack contains playable character Xae, three brand-new digital-exclusive player cards, and three basic nemesis cards

boardgame.name: Aeon's End - The Nameless
boardgame.description:
The Nameless expansion includes:

• Blight Lord - nemesis
• Wayward One - nemesis
• Malastar - playable mage with unique starter card (Immolate)
• One gem - Leeching Agate
• Two relics - Molten Hammer & Temporal Helix
• Four spells - Blaze, Sage's Brand, Scrying Bolt, & Radiance

boardgame.name: Master Minds: A Game of Deduction
boardgame.description:
MasterMinds is a GAME OF DEDUCTION where in order to determine who the MasterMind is, what they're like and where they are, you need to make your way around the board and ask the right questions of the other players using your deductive reasoning skills and the process of elimination, trying to be the first to solve the mystery of who and where the MasterMind is and climb their steps to knock on their door.

In a standard game, each player holds three cards, Description, Character and Place. The remaining 3 cards for the round are the MasterMind's cards. With the occasional advantage or disadvantage of Bonuses and Penalties players make their way around the board Asking Questions and Taking Notes using their Solver Pad until they're ready to Climb The Steps to Make Their Guess and find out if they're at the MasterMinds Door!

Is the MasterMind a Lonely Zombie In Your Closet, a Kind Grandma At The Grocery Store, a Frustrated Time Traveler In The Woods???...It could be anyone, anywhere, IT'S TIME TO PLAY AND FIGURE IT OUT!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aeon's End - The Depths
boardgame.description:
Deep within the earth, lost in the labyrinth of shadows, the Horde-Crone has awakened the troggs to reclaim the ancient city of Gravehold.

The Depths expansion includes:
• Horde-Crone - nemesis
• Nym, Reeve, and Zhana - playable mages with unique starter cards
• One gem - Banishing Topaz
• Two relics - Transmogrifier & Vim Dynamo
• Five spells - Combustion, Devouring Shadow, Disintegrating Scythe, Monstrous Inferno, & Void Bond

boardgame.name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Flight Command – Skulls Pack
boardgame.description:
Exclusive Skulls scenario including:

To celebrate the launch of Aeronautica Imperialis: Flight Command, completely free of charge and exclusive to the Games Workshop Skulls Event, take to the skies as the Stygian Skulls attempt an ambitious if not suicidal incursion into Ork occupied territory in the never to repeated scenario A HILL TO DIE ON, featuring:

The imperial navy Arvus Lighter donned in the livery of the Stygian Skulls – an elite Imperial Guard unit where careers tend to be rather short lived, but what better way to prove one’s faith than to die in service of the Emperor!

The convoy is escorted by Thunderbolts equipped with deadly Skullstrike Missiles, again exclusive to this limited-edition scenario.

Finally, there are two unique steam achievements for you to master and add to your collection of Aeronautical valour!
Of course, you can just as easily take on the role of the Ork Air Waaagh!, bring da dakka and don’t forget to shout Waaagh! dead loud like! Da Orks ‘Eavy Flakk Kannons shud do da job boss!

This pack is limited content for those who support Aeronautica Imperialis: Flight Command! Pick it up now before it is gone!

Thank you for supporting the Launch of Aeronautica Imperialis: Flight Command!

boardgame.name: Momentum: A Strategic Dice Game
boardgame.description:
You'll need to roll the dice for sets and runs for the chance to move your pawns and go for the win...will you take chances, will you play it safe, do you feel like you can get some momentum and go for that big streak!?!? No score pad, no pencils! Have a strategy, weigh the risks and hope for a little luck!!

Momentum is the STRATEGIC DICE GAME where you choose your roll type, FOCUS (best of three rolls) or MOMENTUM (unlimited amount of single rolls until you can't move) and try to be the first to move your four pawns to the center using SETS and RUNS of the dice to advance your PAWNS. The first with their four in the center wins!

Time to warm up those dice and and see if you can get some MOMENTUM!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Atari Vault - 50 Game Add-On Pack
boardgame.description:
Get 50 additional classic Atari releases never before available on PC!

These rarities include 14 vintage Atari arcade games from the 70s, 16 Atari 5200 titles, 12 Atari 2600 games from M Network, and 8 prototype and limited-edition homebrew games for the Atari 2600. As with the original 100 games in Atari Vault, enjoy a richly configurable experience, online multiplayer, and scans of original manuals and boxes.

Games in this add-on collection:

14 Arcade games: Avalanche, Atari® Baseball, Atari® Basketball, Canyon Bomber®, Destroyer, Dominos, Fire Truck, Atari® Football, Maze Invaders, Monte Carlo, Pool Shark, Sky Diver, Atari® Soccer, Super Bug
16 Atari 5200 games: Asteroids®, Centipede®, Countermeasure, Final Legacy, Micro-Gammon, Millipede®, Miniature Golf, Missile Command®, Realsports® Baseball, Realsports® Basketball, Realsports® Football, Realsports® Soccer, Realsports® Tennis, Star Raiders®, Super Breakout®, Xari Arena
12 M Network games for the Atari 2600: Air Raiders, Armor Ambush, Astroblast, Dark Cavern, Frogs and Flies, International Soccer, Sea Battle, Space Attack, Star Strike, Super Challenge Baseball, Super Challenge Football, Swordfight
8 prototype and limited-edition homebrew games for the Atari 2600: Adventure II, Aquaventure, Frog Pond, Holey Moley, Motorodeo, Saboteur®, Wizard, Yars' Return

boardgame.name: Battlefleet Gothic: Armada – Tau Empire
boardgame.description:
The alien Tau Empire has rapidly expanded across the galaxy, aided by highly advanced technology and driven by a total dedication to the Greater Good philosophy. Their fleets excel at long range, with powerful weapons dealing massive amounts of damage from afar. Skilled Tau admirals can eliminate the bulk of an enemy fleet before they can even get within boarding distance. The Tau have access to a wide array of upgrades and traits to improve their Torpedoes and Ordnances even further.

This DLC allows you to play as the Tau Empire fleet, featuring all-new ships, castes and gameplay mechanics, as well as the unique Warfare system.

boardgame.name: Battlefleet Gothic: Armada – Space Marines
boardgame.description:
The Space Marines are the greatest of humanity's warriors, fierce soldiers that have been subjected to intense training, genetic modification, and psycho-conditioning. Their fleets are experts at close-ranged battles, sporting well-armoured ships and specialize in aggressive boarding techniques. In addition, they have access to two unique faction traits which makes them immune to insubordination mechanics and gives them the ability to prioritize their attacks on different subsystems when boarding.

The Space Marines DLC includes 5 different Space Marine chapters.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne - The River
boardgame.description:
Embellish your landscape with the River expansion!

The River expansion lets you embellish your landscape while changing up the starting location. The River is made up of 11 tiles, which replace the starting tile. Take turns placing the River tiles while also deploying meeples. Once you’ve used up the River tiles, continue playing as usual with the other tiles. You must follow the illustration, as always. This expansion lets you more evenly distribute the landscape you’ll create over the course of the game.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne - Inns & Cathedrals
boardgame.description:
Inns & Cathedrals introduces a more strategic gameplay to Carcassonne. With new meeples, buildings and 18 new tiles, the game features even tougher choices each turn.
• Add Inns to your roads to double their point value… or lose everything if you can’t finish them.
• Build majestic Cathedrals at the heart of your cities to increase their scoring… as long as you complete said cities.
• Place your new Large meeples, counting as two of your usual workers! But you only have one so make it count.

It is possible to combine this expansion with others for an even wilder game!

boardgame.name: Carcassonne - Traders & Builders
boardgame.description:
It's all about commerce and construction with the Traders & Builders expansion.

More tiles and more options in this strategy-based expansion.
• Collect trading commodities (wine, cloth and grain), to become Carcassonne's most powerful merchant and win bonus points at the end of a match.
• Meet a new Meeple: the Pig. The farming folk loves pigs - use them to boost your points in field scores.
• Finally, use the builders to get two turns and speed up the building of roads and cities to surpass your opponents!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Objectives – The Clans
boardgame.description: Objectives: The Clans describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of the Clans in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Carcassonne - Winter and Gingerbread Man
boardgame.description:
A cold winter has hit Carcassonne. The citizens waste very little time before preparing hot beverages and sweet pastries. Life around Carcassonne slows down. Occasionally, the people catch a glimpse of a new character, the gingerbread man.

The gingerbread man offers an additional possibility to score each time someone draws a gingerbread man tile.

This expansion is not compatible with the other DLCs.

boardgame.name: Carcassonne - The Princess & the Dragon
boardgame.description:
Discover our new expansion The Princess & The Dragon!
When a dangerous dragon threatens the land of Carcassonne, everybody goes to the rescue: the followers cry out to the Fairy for help, the Princess gathers her army of knights… Will you face the Dragon, or will you flee through the Magic portals? Find out now!
Magic offers new ways to win points and to move your Meeples with The Princess & The Dragon expansion.

Check out the rampaging Dragon Meeple: move it so he can eat up your opponents' Meeples... Unless he eats you first and ruins all your plans!
Ask for help from the Fairy Meeple. She will protect you from the Dragon, and not just that! She will use her fairy magic to give you bonus points!
Have fun with new tiles: the Magic portals. Teleport your Meeples to other tiles using the Magic portals.
As for the Princess, all the Meeples will fight to join her ranks: if there's a Princess in the city, remove all rival Meeples to try to become the knight of the city!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Objectives – The Periphery
boardgame.description: Objectives: Periphery describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of the Periphery in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Galactic Civilizations 3 - Mega Events
Galactic Civilizations III - Mega Events
boardgame.description: Shake up your gameplay with new galaxy-wide Mega Events! These new events introduce additional complexity requiring your skill and strategy to overcome if you hope to be victorious.

boardgame.name: Galactic Civilizations 3 - Crusade
Galactic Civilizations III - Crusade
boardgame.description: Experience a whole new side of Galactic Civilizations III with the Crusade expansion! Discover your enemy’s weak points with espionage, actively invade and conquer planets, and help talented citizens rise to power and drive your civilization into a golden age. With a detailed civilization builder tool for Steam workshop, espionage, revamped invasions, Galactic Citizens system, new races and civilizations, and more, Crusade adds a host of depth for Galactic Civilizations III that players have been craving.

boardgame.name: Micro Game Madness
boardgame.description:
A ziplocked compilation of "Eight Classic and Strange Micro Games" (per the cover blurb) from Tri Tac.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Hunt for Bread in October

boardgame.name: Galactic Civilizations 3 - Retribution
Galactic Civilizations III - Retribution
boardgame.description:
What started as a crusade has become a war of retribution.

Across the galaxy, ancient alien artifacts are being discovered, giving civilizations powerful new capabilities. Meanwhile, as civilizations try to carefully balance building an economy, funding an ever growing war machine, and engaging in diplomacy, the humans of Sol III have invented a game-changing new technology - Hypergates - which, when connected, allow for rapid transit across the galaxy.

With two new major civilizations and the concluding campaign to the Galactic Civilizations III backstory that serves this massive space 4X sandbox game, Retribution asks the question: How will you rule your galaxy?

boardgame.name: Ducks in the Pond
boardgame.description: A Yatzee-style roll n' write for duck enthusiasts and gamers seeking a fun filler. Roll a set of dice for six days attempting to collect different classifications of ducks in the Thibodaux, Louisiana reservoir. Watch out for the weather though which progressively worsens and reduces your dice pool. Dice may be manipulated in some cases. Are you a novice, connoisseur, or professional at duck-watching or just there to get an honorable mention?

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Dice Pack
boardgame.description:
Twenty custom six-sided dice – use them for attack rolls, defensive rolls, and movement rolls!

Includes:

Six yellow
Four blue
Three red
Three green
Two black
Two white

boardgame.name: Battletech: Objectives – Lyran Alliance
boardgame.description: Objectives: Lyran Alliance describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Steiner's Lyran Alliance in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Objectives – Free Worlds League
boardgame.description: Objectives: Free Worlds League describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Marik's Free Worlds League in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Igloo Mania
boardgame.description:
Igloo Mania is a fun game that requires a steady hand! Keep your cool! Don't let the pressure and tension get to you or Parka Pete could fall to his feet - straight through the igloo! Parka Pete has finally placed his last block of ice to complete his igloo. But those pesky penguins have to ruin everything! They're playing a game with their ice picks and pulling out the ice blocks, unbeknownst to Parka Pete. Don't be the penguin who lets him fall into his igloo - or you'll be the losing penguin and Parka Pete will have to start his igloo all over again. A game easy enough for the kids to set up and play on their own, but a fun enough game that even the adults will want to play!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battletech: Objectives – Federated Suns
boardgame.description: Objectives: Federated Suns describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Davion's Federated Suns in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.description: Objectives: Draconis Combine describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Kurita's Draconis Combine in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Objectives – Capellan Confederation
boardgame.description: Objectives: Capellan Confederation describes the state of the major factories, training centers, and command centers of House Liao's Capellan Confederation in the wake of the events described in Jihad Hot Spots: Terra. Including detailed stats on every key system within the realm, this supplement also includes basic rules to help guide players in developing BattleTech scenarios focused on defending--or attacking--these critical sites.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Würfelspiel
boardgame.description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 75 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published for the 75th anniversary of the Emil Seelig AG, which is symbolized by space 75.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Unearthed Tips & Tricks: Monthly (Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unearthed Tips and Tricks: Monthly is a magazine containing a collection of ideas and concepts from the Crit Academy podcast. A D&D talk show designed to provide guidance and inspiration to both players and DMs. With the exception of the monsters, many of the ideas and concepts are system agnostic and can benefit players and DMs in many other systems and settings.

What you get:

Character Concept: We offer character ideas that can help bring your character to life. Whether you need a full character idea or use them as inspiration to enhance your already great character.

Monsters: We can often find that some of our favorite monsters get a little predictable, or we want a little more variation in our selection. We provide new monsters that can keep your characters on their toes, as well as load them up with flavor and lore to be discovered by the loremaster in your group.

Encounters: Here we offer a collection of short scenarios that can be used as a jumping-off point for a full adventure, a one-shot, or dropped into an existing campaign. It's chock-full of unique ideas and scenarios that we hope will spark your creative side, ensuring your players have an experience they will never forget.

Magic Items: Here we share custom magical items that you can drop into your game. Drop them into a chest, or have an enemy wield them against your characters.

Game Master Tips: Being a GM is tough work. Sometimes we could use a little bit of help. Much like a bag of holding, this section is packed to the brim with tips we've learned over the years to help you deliver the best gaming experience possible.

Player Tip: Oftentimes, we as players can take for granted the massive amount of work that the GM puts into the game. In the end, we don’t spend much time thinking about what we can bring to the table. The golden rule every player knows is "Don't be a D*ck!" In this section, we give you tips on how you can avoid doing just that, as well as tips on leveling up your gameplay. Both roleplay, and mechanical.

Two One-Page Adventures: I'm a huge fan of short and sweet. Each issue contains two one-page adventures written by best-selling adventure writers. This ensures you get fun, unique, and engaging adventures to last you through the night.

Adventure Map: Inside you will find a custom map, rich with setting descriptions to spark your imagination. Each copy comes with a link for the digital high-quality map for your hands, or Virtual Table Top experience.

boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Lightning Weapons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bullets won't stop it!

Not a problem!

This book is a supplement to Lightning League, the game of pulp science fiction and horror. Lightning League recreates the horror of early Stomic Age movies and comic books. The monsters encountered are often immune to conventional weapons. To avoid constant recruitment drives the League uses these energy pistols! four models of lightning weapons, three pistols and carbne version are includedalong with an evilo nation's shoddy knock off!

Stats for the weapons are provided for Quantum Engine and are easily modded to other 2d6 games.

boardgame.name: La brujula de Mario: caminante de caminos argentinos
Mario's Compass: Argentinian roads walker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Based on an Argentine television program: Mario´s Compass; Argentine road walker; It is a supplement where it is focused on the Garou and their link with a magical object here in Argentina.

This book contains: A mini story of a spirit of Latinomerica (EL capybara), A new tribal totem: The capybara and a new fetish: Mario's compass (whose power is almost miraculous)


Basado en un programa de television argentina : La brujula de mario; caminante de caminos argentinos; es un suplemento donde esta enfocado en los garou y su vinculo con un objeto magico aca en argentina.

Este libro contiene : Una mini historia de un espiritu de latinomerica (EL carpincho), Un nuevo totem tribal : El carpincho y un nuevo fetiche : La brujula de mario (cuyo poder es casi milagroso)

boardgame.name: Quiz-a-majig: The Crazy Quiz Contraption
boardgame.description:
In this fast-paced quiz game, each player starts with six colored marbles. Choose from one of the five double-sided category sheets and install it in the spinner. Throughout the game, players take turns being the quiz master. On your turn as the quiz master, push down on the lever to get the letter and category dials spinning simultaneously.

Once the spinning stops, the quiz master reads the category and letter aloud - "Countries! L!" All players think fast to come up with a word that fits the category and begins with the letter shown. If you think you've got it, throw one of your marbles into the bowl. Don’t tell out the answer yet because many marbles might go in, but only one will make it to the bottom first. All others will be sent to the tray to be used again later.

The player whose marble made it to the bottom first has five seconds to call out their answer. If they're correct, the quiz master turns the dial counter-clockwise and the marble falls into the quiz tube. But, if they're wrong, the dial gets turned clockwise and the marble can't be used again for the rest of the game!

Keep up the spinning, marble-tossing, and answer-yelling fun for as long as it takes. The first player to get all six of their marbles into the tube wins the game. But if that doesn't happen and the tube gets filled up to the line, the player with the most marbles in the tube wins!

Think fast, pay attention, and try not to lose your marbles as you play the fast-paced game of Quiz-A-Majig.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Call To Adventure: Epic Origins
险途奇踪：史诗的起源
boardgame.description:
In this hero-crafting card game, 1-4 players compete to earn the highest Destiny score while cooperating to defeat the Adversary. Like the original Call To Adventure, Epic Origins is a tableau-building game where players draft cards, cast runes, and overcome challenges to score victory points.

For players familiar with Call To Adventure game system, Epic Origins introduces a high fantasy theme inspired by classic dungeon-crawling RPGs. The new Heritage card type provides options like Elf, Halfling, and Dwarf. Class cards allow you to invest Experience to "level up" your character. High fantasy themes and challenges can be found throughout the game's 150+ unique cards.

This game also features overhauled Solo and Co-Op play. Double-sided Adversaries provide an evolving challenge: face a lower-level Adversary at the end of Act II, then the Final Adversary at the end of Act III. In Campaign Mode, players can unlock new cards by defeating each new Adversary. The game incorporates more rewards for cooperative play while still incentivizing individual achievement.

While points decide the winner of the game, Call To Adventure encourages storytelling at the end of the game. Epic Origins also includes a guide for converting your final tableau into a 5th Edition D&D character.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: District 9: The Boardgame – District Boost Deployable Ally Pack
boardgame.description:
10 unique sculpts to aid your hunt.


Exo Suit 1
Flying Swine
Alien Pet
Gun Tower

Hidden Bomber
District Smuggler
Ride-By-Prawn
District Witch
District Acolyte


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hard Reset - Exile
boardgame.description:
Hard Reset: Exile continues the original story.
Follow Major Fletcher into the Barrens - dangerous lands beyond the last human city of Bezoar, where our hero will meet new foes and make new friends. Get ready for more machine madness!

boardgame.name: Quatermain
boardgame.description:
Hunter. Adventurer. The greatest marksman to ever live. You are Allan Quatermain, searching for wealth deep in colonial era Africa. Grab your gun and wisely choose your allies as you compete in this deck building adventure game. 2-4 players will go on adventures, hunt in the veldt, and trade for new additions to their decks. Try to amass the most wealth, but beware, your allies will determine how many wealth cards you can score at game end.

Each turn consists of four steps:
- Upkeep, if applicable
- Play up to one adventure card
- Go hunting in the veldt
- Make up to one trade for new cards

As you gain new adventure cards, they will open up additional actions, plus you can get upgraded guns to aid in hunting, and allies which remain in play. During Upkeep you select one gun and one ally to journey with you that turn. The game continues until the veldt runs out of animals, at which time whoever can score the most wealth wins.

boardgame.name: Squash
boardgame.description:
Billed as "fantastic clay combat with creatures you design," Squash is a ziplocked compilation of seven "classic" (per the cover blurb) tabletop-miniatures games from Tri Tac.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Broadside Empires of Steel: Three Crowns
boardgame.description: Three Crowns introduces two new nations to Broadside: the Kingdom of Italy and the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

boardgame.name: Cinematic
boardgame.description:
Cinematics is a card game in which players, in the role of director, make various films and participate in international film festivals and win various awards.
Players can use famous superstars to improve the quality of their movies, edit their movies or promote them in various media.

In Cinematic, players must purchase the plan (shot) cards through the special rules of the game to make a movie and then, they must put together genres or matching Kelakets based on the rules, so they can finally create a sequence.
No dice are used in this game and the winner of the game is the one who gets the most points based on the opinions of the jury mentioned in the festival card.
In addition to the main prize of the festival, other players can also win prizes in categories such as “best actor”, “best director”, etc.

boardgame.name: Portals & Pathways, Book #0
boardgame.description:
User Summary

An 8-page supplement for the first edition of Fringeworthy.

Contents include errata corrections, new weapons, clarifications for the Weapons System, language skills, a non-human player character race (the Slargs), and a one-page scenario titled Emree.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Tri Tac Games LLC (Tri Tac Talents)

boardgame.name: Townies
Маленькие города
boardgame.description:
Townies is a roll&write game, where each player will be developing a plan of a small and modern town. They will design its blocks and buildings, trying to adjust to the carousel of different color markers and the ever-changing dice rolls. The one whose city will be the most comfortable to live in will win.

Gameplay
The game is played over a series of rounds. Each round, two Project dice are rolled, and each player, using the marker of their current color, must do one of the following:


Draw a Shape — Fill 4 spaces of their map with the rolled Shape (anywhere on the map, rotated or flipped, but not modified)
Draw an Object and score VP for it — Attach an Object to a Block of the correlating color, according to either the rolled Object OR their current marker.


When everyone is done drawing either the rolled Shape or one of the two Objects, the markers are passed around the table, and a new round begins.

Game End
When anyone announces their 9th Object, the game is over. The player with the most VP wins.

Additional Modes
The players can choose to play with any combination of Individual Goals, Additional Goals, and/or Bonuses that add even more tactical and strategical depth to the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: HE.R.O
boardgame.description:
In HE.R.O you are a recently gratuated doctor who needs to serve the first nighshift at the E.R. You will manage patients, upgrade your skills to treat complicated cases, try to get enough sleep and all while not causing too much Chaos.

HE.R.O is a board game for 2-4 players. The game can be played in cooperative or competitive mode and will include rules for both.

boardgame.name: Witchfinder General: Days of Revelation
boardgame.description:
Witchfinder General: Days of Revelation is set during the period of the 17th Century leading up to the English Civil Wars.

Courageous Witchfinders battle against the many vile abominations that plague a once green and pleasant land. Clandestine vampire factions, aided by their loyal Guardsmen of Blind Obedience, secretly strive to gain ultimate power over a deceived nation. Cruel barguests create fear and mayhem across town and country. Evil witchcraft is rife; vicious werewolves savage the innocent and crazed noctelinger hunt in the shadows.

This exciting wargame rule book contains 108 A4 sized pages of furious wargaming fun. The game is inspired by folklore, myth and the propaganda pamphlets produced by all sides involved in the English Civil Wars. Witchfinder General: Days of Revelation provides background and rules for using: Witchfinders; Angry Villagers; Clubmen; Pikemen; Musketeers; Dragoons; Cavalry; Vampires; Werewolves; Witches; Noctelinger and Barguests.

Designed for use with 28mm scale figures.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Knights contest
Riddertoernooi
Ritter-Turnier
Tournoi de chevaliers
boardgame.description:
Each player receives a knight and a die. The knights are moved towards each other along the tournament path by a dice roll until they meet. Whoever can push the foreign knight back to his starting point with dice rolls wins a tournament point. The first player to achieve an agreed sum of tournament points wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Blast: Klorgon
boardgame.description:
Blast: Klorgon is a new faction for the card game Blast that can be swapped for one of the existing factions in the base game to provide greater replayability.

The unique ability of this faction:
"If you play Klorgon with a total value of 15 or more in a trick, you automatically win the trick."

boardgame.name: Blast: Jedeye
boardgame.description:
Blast: Jedeye is a new faction for the card game Blast that can be swapped for one of the existing factions in the base game to provide greater replayability.

The unique ability of this faction:
"When a Jedeye is used in a winning trick, name a faction and a number. If your opponent has it, they must give it to you."

boardgame.name: テキパキもぎもぎ (Quick to Pick)
boardgame.description:
In this game, the players are two rival fruit hunters in competition to collect fruits from the forest and make more profits!

Quick to Pick is a set collection game that progresses in real time.
Flip Bush cards and collect fruits!
Place same-pattern or same-shape Fruits on top of each other to form sets.
If 3 monkeys find you, run home and calculate your earnings!
Calculate your earnings according to the Market Price card! Whoever has earned more money wins!

boardgame.name: Call to Adventure: The Stormlight Archive – The Thrill Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Promotional card included in the The Way of Kings 10th Anniversary Leatherbound Edition Kickstarter campaign.

The Thrill:

You may not gain this trait if you have any Radiants. When you gain this, gain 1 Experience for each Strength Rune or Constitution Rune in your story.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Call to Adventure: The Stormlight Archive

boardgame.name: Kakitasu sinka ron
カキタス進化論 (Doodled-On Evolution)
boardgame.description:
カキタス進化論 (Kakitasu sinka ron) Doodled-On Evolution is a game from Japan. Animals have survived by undergoing a series of changes called evolution. And evolution takes place when an animal's wish to change is conveyed to its Evolution Agent.

In this game, the players, as Evolution Agents, help animals evolve according to their wishes by the magical "paint-on" pen. If an animal wishes to eat leaves in height, extend its neck and tongue. It would also be nice to extend its limbs.

However, do not be complacent. Other players will ask questions to check if each evolution fulfils the wishes. Through the repeated process of evolution and checking, aim to be the best Evolution Agent.

生命創造系 お絵かきクイズゲーム
進化とは動物たちの「こうなりたい！」というノゾミが、担当の進化係に伝わることで起きている！？
あなたは進化係となり、動物にペンでカキタス(書き足す)ことでノゾミ通りの進化させましょう！
どのノゾミを叶えたか他のプレイヤーに当ててもらうことができれば、優秀な進化係として得点を獲得できます。
上手く伝わるように進化させ、高得点を目指しましょう！
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – 1945
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: 1945 samples a number of designs that played a key role in the largest, and perhaps most critical conflict in Terra's pre-spaceflight history. Representing the military capabilities of the mid-twentieth century powers, most of the designs featured in this book are obsolete even by the standards of the Age of War, their weapons and armor rendered completely ineffective long before the days of the BattleMech.

But if you're going to insist on using the anyway, statistics are included for 24 iconic vehicles and warplanes of the Second World War, complete with special rules that make them ready for play--either against each other, or against thirty-first century tech in BattleTech games where you need a chuckle.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Boondocks
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Boondocks samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up on the lesser-known worlds of the BattleTech universe. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Boondoggles
boardgame.description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Boondoggles samples some of the most infamous failures in military experiments made by the Inner Sphere and Clan powers throughout history.

Each design featured in this book demonstrates a disastrous (or merely abandoned) combination of prototype technology or engineering employed on BattleMechs, combat vehicles, and aerospace units from the Star League age to the Jihad era. Statistics and (where useful) Record Sheets are included for 14 BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units presented in this book, ready to use (if possible) in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – The Clans
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: The Clans samples a number of new designs being produced by the various Clan powers who now call the Inner Sphere home.

Infusing a new wave of advanced Clan technology into the older models at their disposal, most of the designs featured in this book incorporate a mix of modern technologies and design standards the likes of which the Inner Sphere has yet to face in open battle. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, ProtoMechs, vehicles, aerospace fighters, and battle armor are presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: KeyForge: Winds of Exchange
boardgame.description:
Winds of Exchange adds loads of new content for the game, and the best part is the set is already completely developed! In fact, if the algorithm was not broken, the set would already be well on its way to stores this fall. This means that when we do relaunch KeyForge in the future, Winds of Exchange will be ready to produce and hit store shelves.

In addition to a whole new batch of cards and mechanics, Winds of Exchange also introduces the game’s eleventh house, the Compacts of Ekwidon. This is a mercantile house founded by the asymmetrical Getrookya, and it’s all about themes of trade and exchange. Joining the Ekwidon are six returning houses, including Brobnar, Sanctum, Saurians, Star Alliance, Unfathomable, and the long-awaited return of Mars!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – ComStar
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: ComStar samples the custom and prototype designs that were developed in the testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of ComStar's scattered military. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake waged on.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have only begun to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Dixit World
boardgame.description: Beta for the app version of the board game Dixit.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Corporations
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Corporations samples the custom and prototype designs that are still going through their shakedown trials in the corporate research sites throughout the BattleTech universe. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake thunders on.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to face their first actions in real combat, but each has been tailored for an eventual debut on battlefields yet to come. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles and aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Flying Frog DiceFest 2021 Goody Box
boardgame.description:
A promotional (plain white) box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2021.

For Shadows of Brimstone:

Grave Robber’s Den / Untouched Wreckage map tile pack
2 Map cards (Mine and Blasted Wastes, P-914 and P-916)

1 double-sided single map tile connector† (Mine / Blasted Wastes); 1 square deep
2 double-sided single map tile connectors† (Forbidden Fortress / Forest of the Dead and Forbidden Fortress / Belly of the Beast); 1 square deep

Master Samurai Dice Fest 2021 Miniature
Rusty Shovel promo card P-497
Masterclass Revolver promo card P-338
Keg of Dynamite promo card P-329
Infinite Darkness promo card P-339

Horse Chase promo card P-051
