†† This is essentially a 2.5 inch "corridors"
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Other Worlds – Blasted Wastes
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death
A Touch of Evil: Dark Gothic

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Davion
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Davion samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the Federated Suns. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Minesweeper Classic 2
boardgame.description:
User summary

App version of Minesweeper.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Ball Legend
boardgame.description:
Take your team to the championship and become the best quarterback in the league along the way. This solitaire game is a mashup of the Dungeon Ball theme and the Hunted system.

Dungeon Ball Legend can be played in two modes: Exhibition (one game) or Season (six games). In each game, you’ll attempt to guide your team to victory by scoring more points than your opponent, and you’ll try to rack up as many highlights as possible to gain votes in the race to win the Hegzug Trophy (it’s kind of like the Heisman…).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Gladiators
boardgame.description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Gladiators samples the custom designs that have appeared in the arenas of the BattleTech universe during the Jihad. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--now face their live-fire trials in the arenas of the various Game Worlds. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and battle armor units, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Gunslingers
boardgame.description:
Experimental Tech Readout: Gunslingers samples some of the advanced technological experiments developed during the peak years of the Star League era.

Each design featured in this book demonstrates the use of cutting edge Star League equipment on the BattleMechs, combat vehicles, and aerospace craft of the day. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Kurita
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Kurita samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the Draconis Combine. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Salt Mystic
boardgame.description:
Salt Mystic is a science fiction-themed tabletop game based on terrain and trading cards, where the placement and orientation of the cards drive gameplay. Cards represent fleshed-out characters or the vehicles or vehicle upgrades they use, or major story elements that can be played to shift the game's dynamics. It feels like playing a streamlined Warhammer 40k with Magic: The Gathering cards.

1 - 2 players, ages 12 and up, games lasting 30 mins to 1 hr.

Played on a tabletop with cards, six-sided dice, a ruler, and elements representing terrain. Everything required to get started is available in the Sourcebook And Core Rules.

The narrative background of the game and its associated and ongoing book series is based on classics like Dune, Star Wars, Firefly, and Isaac Asimov's Foundation series:

"Two thousand years ago, the Salt Mystic declared her vision of the forces of history, and how to harness them to shape human events. Naraia was the name they gave to the sprawling republic that arose from her teachings, encompassing countless cities on land, floating on the seas and tethered to the seafloor, and tucked into pockets of artificial space called oriels.

All of that shattered a generation ago in a terrifying and almost supernatural conflict called 'The War Of The Rupture'. Now, roving bands of Naraia's remnant fleets and soldiers and its marvelous machines scatter like maple seeds for anyone with a vision to seize them. And abandoned oriels lie in wait for brave explorers with the heart to enter inside."

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Carolus Chess
boardgame.description: Classical chess has its deserved place as the Western reference of abstract strategic games, this game was conceived as one of the various variants and derivatives of "Chaturanga" (game of Indian origin), under that line this proposal derives from classic chess modifying and contributing in mechanics and themes with the intention of providing a fun, modern, accessible, dynamic and deep game alternative.

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: German – Panther
boardgame.description:
The Panther is a powerhouse in every sense of the word with great mobility and firepower allowing you to really run the tank hard on the battlefield. All of this does come at a slight cost however – Weak Flank means that it is susceptible to shots coming in from the side and rear which means you may want to buff it’s initiative stat. Enhanced Suspension is a cheap way to gain a additional point in the movement phase, whilst driver Phil Stulpnagel can improve it even more and adding the sort-after Smooth Ride ability.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: Soviet – ISU-152
boardgame.description:
When you need big, bad and ugly it is hard to go past the ISU-152. This tank destroyer is designed to sit in a concealed position and destroy enemy tanks whilst being impervious to enemy fire thanks to a survivability stat of 2, Fortress, which helps to keep the tank safe when being shot in the side, and the benefits of being a Tank Destroyer which improves the tanks survivability when concealed. If there is one downside the ISU-152 it would be the relatively low initiative, but this can be improved by adding Situational Awareness to your radio operator.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: American – M4A1 Sherman (76mm)
boardgame.description:
The M4A1 Sherman (76mm), much like it’s slightly less powerful brother, is one of the most recognizable tanks of World War II and can be counted on to perform reliably in almost any role on the battlefield. It bring a solid set of stats with a firepower of 5 standing out amongst the crowd meaning you can get away with little to no upgrades. Of course if you want to make a good thing better, then it is hard to beat a Vertical Stabilizer to give your tank an advantage on the move, whilst the Wright Continental R-975C4 engine that enhances your tanks initiative can benefit both M4 Sherman variants, as well as the “yet-to-be-released” M18 Hellcat (can someone say “spoiler”?).

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

boardgame.name: World of Tanks Miniatures Game: British – Churchill VII
boardgame.description:
The Churchill VII could never be confused for a race car but what it lacks in mobility it more than makes up with when it comes to a survivability stat of 3! The Churchill VII takes more to put down than an angry elephant! The Churchill VII is also very interesting as it comes with a couple of great options to enhance the tank to your specific needs. Swap out to a Churchill VI turret and reduce your firepower, but gain the Fortress rule, or upgrade the gun to the OQF 77mm Gun Mk. II to gain an additional firepower at the cost of some of your initiative.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: World of Tanks Miniatures Game (Wargaming.net / GF9)

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – Man of Steel
boardgame.description: Help Jor-El, his wife Lara and their robot Kelex send the infant Superman “Kal-el” into space towards the safety of Earth as Krypton falls into chaos. Find a way inside Jor-El’s home, fight General Zod’s invading forces and battle against Zod himself to save Superman.

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – Batman 75th Anniversary
boardgame.description: Play as Joker and Harley Quinn, setting up a variety of celebration set pieces. Be the Dark Knight and play as some of the most iconic faces of Batman through the years, including his first appearance in Detective Comics #27.

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – Dark Knight
boardgame.description: Experience the heart-pounding chase scene from the iconic film complete with cool vehicles and explosive action. Play as the legendary Dark Knight and Commissioner Gordon, as well as the Joker and his goons as they chase down Harvey Dent’s police escort. Bane and Catwoman from the third film are also playable.

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – Batman of the Future Character Pack
boardgame.description: In a future beyond the years of Bruce Wayne's Batman, a new hero must rise to defend Gotham City against threats both new and familiar. This pack allows the player to control a new Batman - Terry McGinnis - who comes fully-equipped with a technologically-advanced Batsuit allowing him to fly, fire Batarang darts and even turn fully invisible. Players can also access deadly villains like the radioactive Blight and the return of the Joker himself.

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – Arrow
boardgame.description: Inspired by the popular TV series, this pack is set after the shipwreck that leaves Oliver trapped on a treacherous island with Slade Wilson. Experience Oliver’s survival training as they work their way through the jungle to a mercenary camp. In addition to Oliver and Slade, play as fan favorite characters Diggle, Felicity Smoak, Helena Bertinelli, Malcolm Merlyn, Roy Harper and Sarah Lance.

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – Rainbow Character Pack
boardgame.description: In an instant, Batman becomes a rainbow of dazzling action. Armed with the usual array of Bat-Gadgets, The Rainbow Batman’s costume is so bright, it can even be used to deflect incoming laser beams! Rainbow Raider is an artist turned evil who projects beams of brilliant light from his eyes dealing serious damage to any hero that gets in his way. Together these two colorful characters bring some kaleidoscopic chaos to the world of LEGO Batman 3!

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – Bizarro
boardgame.description: To help save his planet from the evil Darkseid, Bizarro clones the Justice League and creates his own Bizarro League. Join Batzarro, the world’s worst detective, angry lady Bizarra, the scared Lantern GreenZarro, and more! Play in story mode and in free play to unlock more characters, vehicles and minikits.

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – The Squad
boardgame.description: A mysterious figure has infiltrated Belle Reve Penitentiary. Smash your way through prison as Deadshot, Deathstroke, Harley Quinn, Captain Boomerang and other members of The Squad to hunt down this infiltrator before all of Amanda Waller's--and The Squad’s—secrets are uncovered. Play in story mode and in free play to unlock more characters, vehicles and minikits.

boardgame.name: LEGO Batman 3: Beyond Gotham – Heroines and Villainesses Character Pack
boardgame.description: Celebrating the fearless females of DC Comics, this collection of super heroines and villainesses allows players to wreak havoc as Raven, battle as Batwoman, tear up the ground as Terra and pack a pretty mean punch as Power Girl! The pack also includes fan-favorites such as alien princess Starfire, water-controlling Mera, animal-mimic Vixen and Stephanie Brown as The Spoiler. They’ll all need to be on their guard against the extremely explosive Plastique and the cold and calculating Killer Frost!

boardgame.name: Vegetasaurus Rex
boardgame.description:
70 million years ago, the earth was inhabited by gigantic living beings known by humanity as dinosaurs. Among these magnificent specimens there was a group that liked to eat plants, they were herbivores. And among them, there was a small group. Four demanding dinosaurs when it came to food called Vegetasaurus. True gourmets who liked to combine plants to make their lunches more palatable.

Be the first dinosaur to prepare 3 recipes to close the game and get the best combinations of them to become Vegetasaurus Rex, the king of herbivores. But be careful with the Tyrannosaurus that prowls the grove, or you will have serious problems.



Hace 70 millones de años, la tierra estaba habitada por gigantescos seres vivos denominados por la humanidad como dinosaurios. Entre estos magníficos especímenes había un grupo a los que les gustaba comer plantas, eran los herbívoros. Y entre ellos, existía un pequeño grupo. Cuatro exigentes dinosaurios en lo que a comida se refería, que se hacía. llamar vegetasaurus. Unos verdaderos gourmets a los que les gustaba combinar plantas para hacer de sus almuerzos algo más apetecible.Sé el primer dinosaurio en preparar 3 recetas para cerrar la partida y consigue las mejores combinaciones de las mismas para convertirte en Vegetasaurus - Rex, el rey de los herbívoros. Pero ten cuidado con el Tiranosaurio que merodea por la arboleda, o tendrás serios problemas.

boardgame.name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #87 – Gurkhas
boardgame.description:
Serving as part of the British Army for nearly 200 years, the Gurkhas have fought in almost every major conflict and theatre of war, including in World War II where they were comprised of 40 battalions. These fearsome Nepalese fighters have deservedly earned a near-legendary reputation of being some of the fiercest and bravest warriors in battle: esteemed by their allies and dreaded by their enemies, and respected by all alike. They are easily recognized by their signature weapon - the long, curved knife known as the kukri - and their motto is "Better to die than to be a coward."

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, although the Gurkhas historically fought in every theatre of war and can be played with any Warfighter WWII setting.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warfighter: The Tactical Special Forces Card Game
Warfighter: The WWII Mediterranean Combat Card Game
Warfighter: The WWII North African Combat Card Game
Warfighter: The WWII Pacific Combat Card Game

boardgame.name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #88 – Desert Rats
boardgame.description:
The evocative nickname "Desert Rats" originated from the 7th Armoured Division, but later expanded to include all the Commonwealth troops - British, Australian, Indian and New Zealand - who fought and distinguished themselves in North Africa. This pack covers the fighting vehicles used by the Desert Rats, as well as featuring the same forces in an adversarial role.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Talento
boardgame.description:
A mediator chooses a photo and delivers 5 cards with phrases to each of the other players. Players choose one of the provocative phrases for the photo and vote for the best one. If your idea is the most creative, congratulations! You gained in talent. He is an advertising genius and gets points for that and a new round is held. The first player to reach a number of points wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: nestorgames GP
boardgame.description:
nestorgames GP is a fast and furious racing game for 2 to 8 players, derived from Top Speed by the same designer, that simplifies many aspects of its predecessor (same mechanism, but using dice instead of cards) and also adds some fun twists such as special items or shortcuts. It is a tribute to the arcade racing games of the 80’s, such as SuperSprint or Nitro.

GAME OVERVIEW (please refer to the rulebook)

The player with the highest qualifying value goes first in the pit lane, with the rest of the players going in the same order as they are sitting and counterclockwise.

On your turn, if your car is belly up (you crashed on your previous turn) flip it over and pass the turn. You car doesn’t move.

Otherwise, roll one of your dice. Then you can opt to stop rolling dice on roll another one, and so on until you’ve either stopped rolling dice or you’ve rolled the same number twice. Notice that you can’t roll more than 6 dice.

One of these three things can happen:


You’ve rolled the same number twice but the car is not on a corner: Your car does not move.



You’re rolled the same number twice and the car is on a corner. You’ve crashed! (see Crashing) Your car does not move.



You’ve stopped rolling so you don’t have repeated results: Add up all the values of the rolled dice and move your car forward exactly that many spaces along the track. Other cars don’t block your movement.


If your car moves and ends its movement on a non-corner space occupied by another car, you bump into it. Move that car one space forward. If, as a result, that car bumps into another car repeat the process. If a bumped car moves into a corner, it crashes (see Crashing). If there was another car (or more) on that corner then all of them crash on that space.

CRASHING: When a car crashes, flip it over belly-up, take one of its dice and place it on its ‘box’ by the side of the pit lane. You won’t be able to use the dice that are in your ‘box’ unless you Fix the car (see Fixing your car).

Races are usually played to 3 laps, but this can be agreed upon. The first car crossing the finish line after that many laps wins.

Additional rules include fixing your car (recover a die), using a shortcut once per race, picking up and using special items (bombs, wrenches, turbo boosters, rockets and oil spills), championships, teams,...

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Too Many Bones: German Language Pack
boardgame.description:
Make your English Too Many Bones copy easier to play with the German Language Pack!

Contains:

Too Many Bones base game rulebook (German translation)
5 Too Many Bones reference sheets (English terms and German translation)
Full set of Too Many Bones base game encounters and loot (German translation)

boardgame.name: Rainbow7
Rainbow7
boardgame.description:
Discard a combination of cards and activate effects!

As soon as your hand is worth seven points or less, get your opponents to draw tokens! But beware of the backlash, otherwise you are the one picking up!

If a player gets his seventh token, the game is over and whoever has the last wins!

boardgame.name: Leaf Blower Revolution
boardgame.description:
Leaf Blower Revolution is a Free to Play idle game where you blow away leaves with nuclear leaf blowers, unlock upgrades, earn achievements, and more.

Are you tired of blowing away leaves IRL? Or have you ever wanted to blow away the stupid leaves with a rocket engine filled with nuclear fuel? Then Leaf Blower Revolution is for you! Purchase Autoblowers, unlock upgrades, earn achievements, and watch the numbers go up.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Twister-Jass
boardgame.description:
Twister-Jass is a new type of Jass for two people. The new Jass provides a lot of variety: because what seems to be a good hand can suddenly turn. Twister-Jass combines tactics, strategy and luck and was invented by a pirate."

Twister Jass is a new take on a traditional trick-taking card game. The goal is to score the most card points, but this is hard to do as the trump suit changes every third trick!

One player leads to the trick. The other player must follow the lead suit or may play a trump card. If a trump card is played, the highest trump card wins. Otherwise, the highest card in the lead suit wins the trick. The trump suit changes every third trick, determined either by a card flip or by a die roll (depending on how you choose to play).

The player who won the tricks with the most card points wins!

boardgame.name: Arrr
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Arrr be a fine pirate adventure for DURF. Created for the DURF Jam.

The Ship is gone.
The Captain is dead.
The Monster is hungry.

Wielding their expendable crew, powerful sea shanties (including the classic ‘Don’t Stop A’ Heaving’) and a variety of dashing pirate outfits, your party will adventure across the island. Will they survive the local hazards, outwit the dreaded Captain Stinkbeard and claim the amulet that controls the sea monster to secure their freedom?

boardgame.name: Creeping Death on Station 66
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Caught in a deep sandstorm in the wastelands of Mars, your team has had to abandon their mining recon, alerted to a place of refuge by a radio transmission. Garbled, you make out “…help, we’re taking precautions and know that no evac is imminent. Supplies low. 53 South, 96 East. End message. Beeeeeeep.”

Creeping Death on Station 66 is a system neutral microsetting designed for the Pocket Places Jam 2021 a collaboration between David Blandy and Sigve Solvaag inspired by The Thing, Alien, and The Vaults of Yoh-Vombis by Clark Ashton Smith.

The setting is sparse space body horror, with 3 NPCs, 3 detailed technical maps of the complex, and 2 tables to decide who is the initial host of the alien parasite, and what items might be found around the base.

The delapidated Medic Station 66 has been infiltrated by a tiny mobile black cloth-like disc, which moves by folding and wrinkling, which subtly enters the body through an orifice and plants seeds in the nasal cavity. The parasite then finds its way to the cerebral cortex, inducing mild euphoria a need for the host to stay close to other potential hosts. Once gestated, the cavity explodes, scattering the newborn.

boardgame.name: The Lost Highway
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Journey down the Lost Highway and learn to fear the creatures who call it home.

Many dead things call this place home. Some do so only for a moment - others for eternity. This is a book about them. About those strange things which you half see in the darkness when driving alone at night. About what drives them to take refuge in the most inhospitable land that exists for kindred tonight - the open road...

The Lost Highway Includes:

Three new ways of un-life found among the Anarchs of the Lost Highway - Hoboes, Capillarians, and Locusts

12 factions and locations designed to be useable anywhere in the U.S.

17 new characters who walk the highway tonight

A new Path of Enlightenment - the Path of the Swarm

boardgame.name: Anverso Reverso
Recto Verso
boardgame.description:
Build the house from the map as quick as possible. A re-edition of La Boca with new art and a two player mode.

Creating skylines of similar beauty and eccentricity is the goal of the construction teams that play Recto Verso. In shifting teams of two that sit across from one another, players try to create skylines on challenge cards – but the players can see the completed image only from their point of view, so they must consult with one another constantly to make sure each colored block ends up in the right location while racing against the timer. The faster the players complete their building, the more points they score. Then the next team takes a seat, breaks down the blocks, then begins building anew. Whoever has the most points after a certain number of rounds wins.

A new 2 player cooperative mode has been added to this edition.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Recto Verso (NL/FR) Publisher: Super Meeple Language(s): French Dutch

boardgame.name: The Diablos
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a rebellion falls, the first thing to believe is that it is over. But in this mini-entry for The Year of the Road, one group of Renegades will get a second chance to set things right and strike fear in the hearts of slavers everywhere.

The Diablos includes:
• Two new Shadow archetypes
• Rules to play this wandering gang in other modes

boardgame.name: Naiad
boardgame.description:
A game about nature.
Immerse yourself in a relaxing, minimalist and colorful exploration adventure.

Source: The Developer Website.


User summary

Officially release in Q2 2022, but was released in November 2021 on the Humble Bundle Trove and for Humble Bundle subscribers

boardgame.name: Shadows of Brimstone: Resin Master Samurai
boardgame.description: An alternate miniature for the Samurai player class at high level. Part of the Flying Frog DiceFest 2021 Goody Box.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Shadows of Brimstone: City of the Ancients
Shadows of Brimstone: Swamps of Death

boardgame.name: Valenrelm
boardgame.description:
In Valenrelm you play as a kingdom that is competing for domination of the land. Start the game by choosing which kingdom you will play as and the tactic and specialty you will start off with. Tactics change the way your armies move on the map and specialties give you a bonus in one area. You can change these during the game as the world map unfolds changing situations require new capabilities.

There are two main decks that you draw from, the tile deck and the action cards. The tiles are used to explore the world and build the world map as the game progresses. This means the game has near infinite variation and no two games will ever result in the same world map. As you explore, you will encounter brigands who have come to inhabit the land of Valenrelm. Defeat them in battle and occupy the farms and villages they guard to expand your kingdom and gain the resources you'll need to recruit more armies and play action cards. Farms provide you with food while villages provide either iron, wood, or stone. There are also camps and castles that are used to recruit armies. The different types of armies have different abilities on the world map and are useful in different situations. Moving your armies on the map will allow you to conquer more territory.

Action cards are used to give you a temporary advantage over the other players. Most of the cards cost resources so having a steady supply of them is essential. Some cards affect your armies, some affect the armies of other players, some have negative effects. Using them at the right time could tip the balance of power and help you achieve victory.

When armies battle, the two players use their battle cards to play out the battle on the battlefield. Every player has the same battle cards unless they have chosen one of the specialized armies that has their own unique battle card. The cards are orders to the units in your army to perform a specific maneuver on the battlefield. The maneuvers each have their own offensive and/or defensive capabilities. Each player chooses their three cards for the center and left and right flanks and reveals the cards at the same time. You could order one of your units to charge at the enemy but if their unit used shield wall, the attack would be blocked. Another unit could flank the shield wall and defeat it. The battle mini games are quick, only lasting a minute or two. You could win, lose, or tie a battle. The result of the battle then effects what happens on the world map.

You can win by occupying most of the settlements, all of the castles, being very wealthy, or destroying everyone else's settlements. Valenrelm is a dangerous place where your fortunes could change at any moment. How will you forge your path to victory?

boardgame.name: The Long Road
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Long Road is a sourcebook for Hunter the Reckoning and other World of Darkness hunter chronicles set on the road.

Chapter One contains stats for a wide variety of vehicles, new rules for modifying vehicles, and new Merits and Flaws and a new Wayward Edge.

Chapter Two offers new systems for vehicle personlities and dramatizing hunters growing infamy, the grind of the road, and the difficulty such a life imposes. With Storyteller advice for such chronicles.

Chapter Three provides examples of three strange locations and three monsters ready to drop into your chronicle.

boardgame.name: The Meditant (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the help of meditation, breathing exercises, and visualization, meditants develop a sixth sense, gaining the ability to process sensory data — both tangible and intangible stimuli — to push their minds and bodies beyond normal limits. Meditants blend a unique combination of intuitive ability with intellectual study of maths and sciences to accomplish their goals. Meditants are healers, academics, and artists — they identify and release areas of blockage in the body, restoring health and balance, apply the laws of science and mathematics to achieve stunning feats of athleticism, and as they perfect their inward journey of self discovery, they master the art of becoming one with their weapon in combat, executing a choreographed series of thrusts and parries to claim victory on the battlefield.

boardgame.name: Way of the Compass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Enhance your Monk character with a multitude of abilities in this new Tradition.

Way of the Compass - A Monastic Tradition

Harness the power that flows through both the living and the inanimate, alter the perceptions of the world around you, and even learn to master time itself!

Over 40 new abilities that expand the Monk class. Complete with tables and full descriptions of each ability, as well as cards and a reference chart for easy gameplay at the table.

boardgame.name: The DMs Guide to Travel
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The DMs Guide to Travel is a rules supplement containing suggestions, tips, and guidelines for preparing and running travel in your 5th Edition D&D campaigns.

This supplement includes:

Eight Methods to Prep & Run Travel

Two Sample Skill Challenges

A Template to Design Your Own Skill Challenge

Tips on Incorporating Multi-Session Travel into a Campaign

boardgame.name: The DMs Guide to Hunting
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The DMs Guide to Hunting is a rules supplement containing hunting mechanics and an abundance of quarries to use in your games. Among these quarries are real mammals, reptiles, birds, and other animals reimagined for D&D 5th Edition and new, completely original fantasy animals.

This supplement includes:

Simple and Easy-to-Use Mechanics for Hunting

Optional Rules for Hunting Proficiency & Magical Equipment

Tables with 100 Quarries to be Caught

boardgame.name: Alternative Medicines: A Compendium of Fascinating Alternatives for Healing
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

100 magic items, including potions, salves, ointments, wraps, slings, and more! Included with each item is a brief history or background for inspiration in any game.

The realms can be a dangerous place, and intrepid adventurers are always in need of healing, restorative, curative, and preventative items. Sometimes a plain healing potion just won’t do. With this in mind, we have compiled a listing of the various and sundry medicinal magic items we have found across the lands, gathered here in one place for your perusal.

Many of these wondrous remedies are easy to acquire, especially in the larger cities and urban centers that many of our citizens call home. Even still, plenty of opportunity to procure some of the more basic alternatives to a simple healing potion listed herein can be found in even the most remote and isolated burgs and hamlets one may find oneself encountering while “on the road”, as it were.

Inspect and scrutinize our gathered information, and we will take the utmost in satisfaction knowing that we may have imparted some knowledge that may very well have saved a life, or at the very least made the dear reader’s adventures a bit less unpleasant.

boardgame.name: Underbelly: The Seedy Side of Town
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Underbelly: The Seedy Side of Town has 100 pages of brand new material exploring the criminal element of any town or city. Not your typical Thieves' Guild, this is a compilation of criminals, encounters, and locations that make any campaign come alive.

• 13 unique criminal enterprises
• Multiple plot hooks for every location
• 50 Detailed NPCs and Monsters
• 15 New Magic Items
• A Completely New Bard College
• A Gossip Generator that works for ANY game
• Expanded Rules and Examples for Tracking Down People and Places
• Newly Expanded Chase Rules and a detailed example
• Rules for New Games of Chance
• Several New Poisons and Their Recipes
• A Variety of Maps and Methods for Using Simple Geomorphs
• Guidelines for lowering or Increasing the Difficulty of Almost Every Encounter

boardgame.name: Saltmarsh Sidetreks: Tier 1 Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Saltmarsh Sidetreks. Within these 67 pages you will explore the swashbuckling, seafaring, smuggler infested shores of Saltmarsh, and the seas beyond!

We have taken a bunch of the adventure hooks printed within Ghosts of Saltmarsh and fleshed them out. Now you have the opportunity to take both DMs and Players alike deeper into the town of Saltmarsh.

Not only will this book allow your players to have immersive interactions with existing NPCs and locations in Saltmarsh, it also includes the following to help expand your campaign into the political world of Saltmarsh even further.

• 12 sidetrek adventures for Tier 1 play, fully incorporated into Saltmarsh with its politics and personalities

• 18 highly detailed maps included as a ZIP file for use in your virtual table top gaming or print them as full size battle maps if desired

• New magic items specifically tailored for Saltmarsh

• New monsters to terrorize your players

• New NPCs to use with the included adventures, or for use by Players as well!

All this and more. We even included a table of contents as a helpful guide on how to best insert these side treks into the existing Ghosts of Saltmarsh, or if you choose, use the side treks by themselves and run your own campaign altogether.

The choices are yours, and they are many. Whatever you decide to do with the information contained within these pages, we hope over all, you have fun!

boardgame.name: On the Road: Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Guide to Interesting Travel Encounters

Get out of the travel rut! No more hand waving the journey away. Bring back a sense of distance and wonder to your journeys, and let your players experience the world around them every day.

This booklet provides a set of detailed encounters that the DM can use to flesh out any overland journey. These encounters shine when using the travel-montage approach, and can be combined, adjusted, expanded, or just used for inspiration.

What in there?

25 all new encounters you can use for road travel. Some encounters could lead to side adventures, while others may affect different events during the day or later in camp. Many can be combined into mini stories. Where appropriate, notes are included on adjusting the encounter for higher or lower Challenge Ratings.

10 new magic items! From the small and useful to the powerful and perhaps cursed.

Experience everything from chatty farmers to natural hazards, from an ancient curse held in check to time travel, games of chance, and fortunetelling!

boardgame.name: About Town: Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Collection of Interesting NPCs

Colorful, deep, and interesting NPCs can bring almost any situation to life. This collection aims to do just that, presenting 25 NPCs from all facets of a medieval society. Everyone from actors to blacksmiths, ratcatchers to innkeepers. Each with personalities, motivations, connections, and hooks you can use for almost any urban setting, big or small.

What’s in there?

25 fully detailed NPCs for use in any city or town, complete with descriptions, stat blocs, encounter locations, connections, secrets, and hooks for every one. Plus 6 new magic items (1 unique sentient weapon) that tie directly into their stories!

boardgame.name: Terrain Enchiridion: Arctic Creatures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first installment of the Terrain Enchiridions series is here!

The arctic can be a dangerous place. The unforgiving terrain, the possibility of losing your way, the howling winds, the unrelenting cold. And now a whole host of arctic creatures that your party might encounter!

14 new creatures ideally suited to the arctic wilderness, one for each type of creature in the Monster Manual. Plenty to surprise, scare, sand delight your players!

Ranging from CR 2 to 23, experience a variety of creatures at home in the cold, including the cute but deadly Stoatfolk (a possible playable race), the horrific Black Ice Wights (with a template for making your own), the devious Kashava (northern cousin of the Rakshasa), the nightmare-inducing Scuttle (an aberration you won’t soon forget), and the tremendous Galcierform (sure to challenge even the hardiest of adventurers).

boardgame.name: Terrain Enchiridion: Swamp Creatures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The next installment of the Terrain Enchiridions series is here!

Swamps can be a dangerous place. The unforgiving terrain, the possibility of losing your way, the biting insects, the unrelenting oppressiveness. And now a whole host of creatures that you might encounter!

14 new creatures ideally suited to swamps, marshes, and bogs, one for each type of creature in the Monster Manual. Plenty to surprise, scare, sand delight your players!

Ranging from CR 1/4 to 20, experience a variety of creatures at home in the swamps, including the cute but deadly Batakhalik, or swamp otterfolk (a possible playable race), the horrific Boo Hag (including info on their covens), the devious Marsh Wraiths (undead tricksters), the nightmare-inducing Silt Lurker (another aberration you won’t soon forget), and the tremendous Muck Dragon (with stats from wyrmling to ancient).

boardgame.name: Magical Clothing for Discerning Adventurers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fashion isn’t just for Bards! This catalog features over 100 different magical clothing items.

•General clothing
•Outerwear
•Footwear
•Headwear
•Accessories
•Special Order (2 legendary artifacts)

Everything you need to outfit your next character! None of the clothing items are gender specific, so you can use them for any character you dream up.

Players: convince your DM that you need to go shopping

DMs: fill out a clothing shop in the city, be prepared for that PC shopping spree, or use these for interesting NPCs

boardgame.name: Creatures of Chaos Codex 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

50 creatures from the fevered imagination of Tarnix the Timid! Everything from the CR 1/8 Demonic Droplet to the CR 30 Burbling Swimbright. The range of creatures is amazing!

Presented as the lost field notes of the adventurer Tarnix the Timid, each entry has full stats, the translated notes from Tarnix, full-color artwork, and a note of clarification from one of his adventuring companions.

The creatures presented in this book have not been balanced using any official method. The basis for them was to randomly generate all of the various statistics for a 5th edition creature, and see what we could come with. Some effort has been made to make each at least somewhat playable.

The stories that Tarnix recorded in his field notes should probably be taken with a grain of salt, or even a pile of the stuff. Perhaps the most unreliable of narrators, his companions seem to have set the record straight on more than one occasion.

That is not to say that you should not consider the creatures presented here as anything other than “real”. They were certainly real to Tarnix, and his companions obviously had many encounters over the years that defy explanation.

So, have fun with these creatures, throw them at your players, and see what happens!

boardgame.name: Contraptions of Chaos Codex 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

100 magic items from the fevered imagination of Tarnix the Timid!

Presented as the lost field notes of the adventurer Tarnix the Timid, each entry has rules on using the item, full-color artwork, and a note of clarification from one of his adventuring companions.

The magic items presented in this book may or may not have worked as Tarnix described. He was certainly convinced of their powers. His companions tell a different tale. Who is to say when magic is involved?

Many of these items have a price to pay for using their powers, and perhaps his companions underestimated his commitment. Or perhaps Tarnix underestimated his own!

Have fun with these, throw them out there for your players, and see what happens!

boardgame.name: Anderian Adventures: Bitter Fruits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The third in the series for Chivalry & Sorcery 5th Edition, set in the Fantasy The Kingdom of Anderia. First was the Ebony Box. In That Adventure, the characters recovered the Churches artefact. The second one was set in the isolated Town of Gengorge, where things got unreal. The characters were tasked with the rescue of the Mayor's Son.

In this game, the challenges are bigger and the rewards are commensurate with the scale of the adventure. This covers the Ancient cave of Bitter fruits that legend tells have magickal properties. Can the group survive the mountains and the guardians of the caverns?

The game is for a group of beginning adventurers. 2nd -4th Level. As the series progresses the characters will have the chance to make powerful allies and more than a few enemies too.

boardgame.name: The Forgotten Gate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The ward on the gate to a forgotten Deepland hall has failed, leaving the surrounding countryside defenseless against the hordes of endrori ready to attack from the caverns below. It is up to you and your stalwart companions to fight your way to the ancient gate, defeat the dark and terrible creatures that block your path, and protect the elderly Warder of Alantra, whose divine magic can seal the forgotten gate.

The Forgotten Gate is a short, action-packed adventure for 4-5 1st level characters and designed for use with the Fifth Edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying game. The adventure takes place in the Scir of Dunbury, part of the World of Aetaltis setting, but it is easily inserted into any traditional fantasy roleplaying campaign.

So grab your blade and spellbook, gather your most courageous companions, and get ready to start your adventure in the World of Aetaltis!

boardgame.name: Lava Cave System
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explorer: Lava Cave System is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Explorer: Lava Cave System is a standalone set, comprising five 30x30 battlemaps. Each tile depicts a different and unique lava-filled cavern. Whilst each tile works perfectly well on its own, they can also be joined together (in sequence) to make a long network of volcanic tunnels and caves.

Please Note: These maps are not geomorphic, but can seamlessly join together in a line (Maps 1,2,3,4,5 )

boardgame.name: Cave System
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explorer: Cave System is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Explorer: Cave System is a standalone set, comprising five 30x30 battlemaps. Each tile depicts a different and unique series of cave tunnels, chambers and caverns. Whilst each tile works perfectly well on its own, they can also be joined together (in sequence) to make a long, deep cave network.

Please Note: These maps are not geomorphic, but can seamlessly join together in a line (Maps 1,2,3,4,5 )

boardgame.name: Mine Complex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explorer: Mine Complex is a set of printable battlemaps compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game.

Explorer: Mine Complex is a standalone set, comprising five 30x30 battlemaps. Each tile depicts a length of mine tunnels and networks. Whilst each tile works perfectly well on its own, they can also be joined together (in sequence) to make a long stretch of mines to explore.

Please Note: These maps are not geomorphic, but can seamlessly join together in a line (Maps 1,2,3,4,5 )

boardgame.name: Super Snipers
boardgame.description:
Super Snipers is a 1-2 player head-to-head sniper dueling game featuring a familiar tetris mechanic used in a novel and exciting way.

In Super Snipers, players assume the roles of genetically and cybernetically enhanced soldiers, each racing to locate and kill the other Super Sniper first. They do this by placing polyominoes (called “Focus”) onto grids. They must locate their opponent, isolate innocent bystanders, and make their kill. The first player to make 3 kills wins.

Super Snipers has a simultaneous turns Duel Mode, a real-time Quickdraw Mode, a solo turn-based Contract Mode against an automa, and an intense solo real-time Hostage Rescue Mode against two automa in a hostage situation.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Monastic Tradition: Way of the Tilting Hourglass
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

World-weary travelers will sometimes be shocked upon returning to a monastery they’d previously visited years later, only to find that its insular community has not changed one iota over the years. With practiced meditation, monks following the Way of the Tilting Hourglass develop the ability to regulate the flow of time around them, granting them uncanny speed in battle and slowing their foes to a glacial crawl.

Expanding upon the mechanics of the 5E Monk class, this PDF allows you to create monks who have developed a mastery over their personal sense of time, allowing them to speed themselves up or slow enemies in battle.

boardgame.name: The Eldryn: A Union of Elf and Dryad (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Answer the Call of the Forest

Inside, you’ll find a new race for use in your fifth edition games. This cross between elves and dryads draws on the powers of nature and internal mystical energy in the form of one of five different tree bonds to defeat their opponents and overcome challenges.

You’ll also find over two dozen class specializations and backgrounds to further customize your game experience, all specifically crafted to keep play balance while bringing something fresh and new to the table. This is a great book if you're looking for more character options.

boardgame.name: Basilisk Hills Ultimate
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book combines the Compiled Basilisk Hills cluster with the Supplemental book, creating a hexcrawl region of 107 total 6-mile hexes.

Supplemental Hexcrawl

Consisting of 98 6-mile hexes that surround the main Basilisk Hills cluster, this supplemental book provides enough dungeons, lairs, and interesting features to keep your players exploring for months of game time. Written for Old School Essentials, but useable in any old-school system, the book also contains background on the world of Absalom as well as tips on how to run the hexcrawl.

Compiled Cluster

14.22 Lair of the Troglodytes
13.22 The Plateau of Sighs
14.23 The Basilisk Knights
15.22 The Toppled King
15.21 The River’s Source
14.21 The Gateway to the Pallid Fields
13.21 The Gangrenous Orcs


Together, they form an adventuring location that can keep your players busy for months of game time. In addition to multiple dungeons and lairs, the book contains:

A town suitable for use as a home base for the players during their explorations.
New spells and magic items.
New classes, including the half-dryad grove guardian, troglodytes, morlocks, orcs, and more.
New rules for expanding your OSR-style game, including magical research and ritual magic, running a clerical temple, ley lines and engines, ways to make dragons unique.
Much more!

boardgame.name: The Basilisk Hills Compiled Hexes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book compiles the seven hexes that make up the Basilisk Hills cluster of the Populated Hexes series into a single book:

14.22 Lair of the Troglodytes
13.22 The Plateau of Sighs
14.23 The Basilisk Knights
15.22 The Toppled King
15.21 The River’s Source
14.21 The Gateway to the Pallid Fields
13.21 The Gangrenous Orcs


Together, they form an adventuring location that can keep your players busy for months of game time. In addition to multiple dungeons and lairs, the book contains:

A town suitable for use as a home base for the players during their explorations.
New spells and magic items.
New classes, including the half-dryad grove guardian, troglodytes, morlocks, orcs, and more.
New rules for expanding your OSR-style game, including magical research and ritual magic, running a clerical temple, ley lines and engines, ways to make dragons unique.

boardgame.name: Basilisk Hills Supplemental Hexcrawl
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Consisting of 98 6-mile hexes that surround the main Basilisk Hills cluster, this supplemental book provides enough dungeons, lairs, and interesting features to keep your players exploring for months of game time. Written for Old School Essentials, but useable in any old-school system, the book also contains background on the world of Absalom as well as tips on how to run the hexcrawl.

boardgame.name: Gateway to the Pallid Fields
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This hex is another in the Basilisk Hills cluster, and also ties in with the Pallid Fields mini-hexcrawl in Faery. It features the eponymous gateway to Faery, a feral damselfly automaton, and a mad hermit, among other features. It also has rules for high-level ritual spells, spell research and mishaps, in addition to founding and running clerical temples.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Liao
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Liao samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the Capellan Confederation. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake continues.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Interface RED
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Night City’s voracious, choomba! It needs more places, more people, more things. More! More! More! It’s never satisfied and we know you aren’t either. Your campaigns can always use a little something extra to push it right over the Edge.

That’s what Interface RED is all about. In this first volume you’ll find a collection of short articles custom-crafted to improve your Cyberpunk RED experience. We’ve featured many of these articles on our website as free DLC for you to download to your data storage device of choice but this is the first time any of them have been collected in a single volume! Plus, we’ve thrown in a new, exclusive article. You asked for more drones and the Cyberpunk RED crew has delivered.

Volume 1 of Interface RED adds the following to your Cyberpunk RED game:


Old Guns Never Die: A step-by-step conversion guide for bringing weapons from Cyberpunk 2020 into Cyberpunk RED.
Red Chrome Cargo: One of our most popular Screamsheet adventures.
The Single Shot Pack: Ten pregenerated PCs (or NPCs if you need them) and six pregenerated NET Architectures. All to help you start playing faster.
Cyberchairs: New options for mobility. Who needs two cyberlegs when you can ride around on a stylish mobile platform?
Elflines Online: Not one but two articles detailing Night City’s most popular MMO, Elflines Online, along with some of the people who play it.
All About Drones: Never before seen, All About Drones brings two new security drones, the Savannah Eagle and Panther to Night City. Plus, you’ll get three new personal drones, none of which need a NET Architecture to operate.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Marik
boardgame.description:
Experimental Technical Readout: Marik samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the crumbling Free Worlds League. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake winds toward its final conclusion.

These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations--have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Aquatania
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gnomish Science Council has lost a "vehicle" off the coast while exploring sunken ruins. They have requested that your group head that way and attempt to determine what happened and return any survivors if possible. You've all heard the rumors of Aquatania as being an advanced culture, you never thought you'd visit it!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules D&D for the Filbar Campaign for six, fourth level adventurers and DM.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Mercs
boardgame.description: Experimental Technical Readout: Mercs highlights a sample of the prototype designs that have begun testing in the BattleTech universe during the Jihad. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies to debut in the war against the Word of Blake, as first described in Tactical Operations. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and fighters, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Random Fun Generator 2
boardgame.description:
Random Fun Generator 2 is a 76-page 7" x 10" B&W book that we're offering in both print and PDF. It's written by Sam Mitschke and Randy Scheunemann, and illustrated by Len Peralta, includes over 20 new dice games – all of which can be played with standard six-sided dice.

This is a stand-alone sequel to Random Fun Generator and can be enjoyed on its own. The original collection is not required to use these new games!

boardgame.name: The Arduin Fantasy Card Collection
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher:

The Arduin Fantasy Card Collection contains 72 fully illustrated Monster, Artifact and Magic Weaponry cards set for print on parchment stock.

The back of the monster cards contain detailed descriptions complete with stats (compatible with any fantasy role playing system) while the artifact and weapon cards contain a handy form so that you can customize them with your own special brand of magic!

A re-release of David A. Hargrave's Arduin cards, originally released in the 1980's.

With some new art, and all the original monster descriptions.

boardgame.name: Oni Mother Okawa
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Mother Okawa is a 5e adventure designed for 3-6 Level 4 characters for use with the 5th Edition ruleset.

boardgame.name: Compleat Arduin Character Sheet
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:

Designed for use with the Compleat Arduin system.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Periphery
boardgame.description: Experimental Technical Readout: Periphery samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the scattered realms of the local Periphery. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake winds toward its final conclusion. These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations --have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: The Sea Domain
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Cleric sub-class for 5E, focused on the worship of bountiful but harsh sea gods. It is a melee skirmisher subclass that fits perfectly into an island hopping sea adventure but can bring that same utility to any inland adventure as well.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Experimental Technical Readout – Pirates
boardgame.description: Experimental Tech Readout: Pirates samples the custom designs that have appeared in the BattleTech universe during the Jihad. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere in their war against the Word of Blake, as first described in Tactical Operations-deployed now by the malcontents daring enough to steal them. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, and aerospace units, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: The Swordmage
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Swordmages are practitioners of both the martial and mystic arts. They empower thier weapons with arcane might before heading into the fray. Melee skirmishers who are meant to get upclose and personal with the enemy.

This product is a full class for 5E. It includes the base class, 3 sub-classes, a new fighting style, and 15 new spells. It is a "gish" class, a fighting class that enhances itself with spellcasting.
